event.title: said in most rural counties, between 18 percent and 30 percent or more of jobs are now

data.event: Randy Cantrell, with the university’s Rural Initiative, said in most rural counties, between 18 percent and 30 percent or more of jobs are now due to self-employment.
Cantrell details the phenomenon and other observations about Nebraska’s economic and demographic changes in a new report based on 2007 census data and other federal statistics.
Census data released this week shows the state’s three largest counties ” Douglas, Lancaster and Sarpy ” grew by 14,240 people collectively in 2008.
Census data released this week shows the state’s three largest counties ” Douglas, Lancaster and Sarpy ” grew by 14,240 people collectively in 2008.
The rural poll will take another shot at the “business” question this year, which is on its way to 7,000 Nebraska households.

event.title: declined in this population group during this decade

data.event: All but seven counties in the state declined in this population group during this decade, he said in the report.
